screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##

CVE-2024-44207
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-04T17:31:41.970000

7 posts

This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.0.1 and iPadOS 18.0.1. Audio messages in Messages may be able to capture a few seconds of audio before the microphone indicator is activated.

AAKL at 2024-10-08T16:39:39.904Z ##

The advisory includes CVE-2024-44204 and CVE-2024-44207.

Cyble: #Apple Issues Urgent Security Advisory for #iOS and iPadOS Vulnerabilities https://cyble.com/blog/apple-issues-urgent-security-advisory-for-ios-and-ipados-vulnerabilities/ @aucyble #cybersecurity #infosec

##
aapl@mastodon.ml at 2024-10-04T08:20:02.000Z ##

🔓 Помимо исправления багов и ошибок, в свежих обновлениях iOS/iPadOS 18.0.1 также закрыли уязвимости

В документе (https://support.apple.com/en-us/121373) 👨‍🔧 Поддержки были перечислены две уязвимости под кодовыми номерами: CVE-2024-44207 и CVE-2024-44204.
Первый баг касался работы индикатора микрофона в 💬 iMessage на iPhone 16 при записи голосового сообщения – существовал риск обхода его активации на несколько секунд. Вторая уязвимость уже присутствовала на всех моделях, на которых работает система и заключалась в том, что сохранённые 🔑 пароли пользователя могли быть прочитаны вслух с помощью 🔊 VoiceOver без запроса владельца устройства.

Компания поблагодарила нашедших эти недочёты, даже если они сохранили анонимность.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T00:02:55.790Z ##

@lyceris I paraphrased both for brevity and convenience but they're bad audio security risks:

CVE-2024-44207 in Media Session: Audio messages in Messages may be able to capture a few seconds of audio before the microphone indicator is activated

CVE-2024-44204 A logic issue in Passwords: A user's saved passwords may be read aloud by VoiceOver

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-03T23:29:55.365Z ##

Apple security advisories: About the security content of iOS 18.0.1 and iPadOS 18.0.1
2 security fixes: CVE-2024-44207 Audio messages captures audio before microphone indicator is activated, and CVE-2024-44204 VoiceOver might read a user's saved passwords OUT LOUD, WHAT THE FUCK

macOS Sequoia 15.0.1, watchOS 11.0.1, visionOS 2.0.1, Safari 18.0.1 were also updated but have no published CVEs.

#apple #vulnerability #CVE

1 repos

https://github.com/mbog14/CVE-2024-44193

Tinolle at 2024-10-07T12:43:19.582Z ##

Hacking Windows through iTunes  - Local Privilege Escalation 0-day https://github.com/mbog14/CVE-2024-44193

##
aapl@mastodon.ml at 2024-09-27T05:01:15.000Z ##

📄 Apple обновила iTunes для Windows (https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9pb2mz1zmb1s?rtc=1&amp;hl=ru-ru&amp;gl=BR) до версии 12.13.3

Внутри, помимо поддержки новых систем и устройств, также закрыта критическая уязвимость под кодом CVE-2024-44193, позволявшая злоумышленнику иметь приоритет над параметрами программы.

iTunes на Windows до сих пор работает и обновляется, при том, что у компании для этой системы также есть параллельно три отдельных приложения: 🔄 Apple Devices, 🎵 Apple Music и 📺 Apple TV.

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #meraki #cve

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities

    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability

  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)

  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

CVE-2024-47804
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T13:50:43.727000

2 posts

If an attempt is made to create an item of a type prohibited by `ACL#hasCreatePermission2` or `TopLevelItemDescriptor#isApplicableIn(ItemGroup)` through the Jenkins CLI or the REST API and either of these checks fail, Jenkins 2.478 and earlier, LTS 2.462.2 and earlier creates the item in memory, only deleting it from disk, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to save the item to persi

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.000Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-47803
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T13:50:43.727000

2 posts

Jenkins 2.478 and earlier, LTS 2.462.2 and earlier does not redact multi-line secret values in error messages generated for form submissions involving the `secretTextarea` form field.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

##

CVE-2024-45519
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.03%

updated 2024-10-04T13:34:19.720000

58 posts

The postjournal service in Zimbra Collaboration (ZCS) before 8.8.15 Patch 46, 9 before 9.0.0 Patch 41, 10 before 10.0.9, and 10.1 before 10.1.1 sometimes allows unauthenticated users to execute commands.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-10-03T17:09:48.344Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press!!! CVE-2024-45519 Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Command Execution Vulnerability added to the KEV

#cisa #kev #cve_2024_45519 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #activeexploitation

##
decio at 2024-10-03T08:35:25.294Z ##

⚠️ SI vous administrez un service mail Zimbra, c'est le moment de le mettre à jour
⬇️
Une vulnérabilité critique, CVE-2024-45519, est activement exploitée dans la nature, permettant à des attaquants de compromettre les serveurs vulnérables. Exploitation de masse en cours avec des mails malveillants tentant d'exécuter des commandes via CC. ⚠️
(Historiquement, on sait que ce type d’attaque peut évoluer très rapidement et être exploité par plusieurs acteurs malveillants.)

Plus d'info:

"Fixed a security vulnerability in the postjournal service which may allow unauthenticated users to execute commands.
👇
https://wiki.zimbra.com/wiki/Zimbra_Security_Advisories

"Zimbra bug causes alarm among researchers, CERTs after exploitation attempts"
👇
https://therecord.media/zimbra-email-vulnerability-exploitation

#Cyberveille #zimbra #CVE_2024_45519

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-10-03T04:35:09.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-45519 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-45519/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_45519

##
gertvdijk@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T11:37:49.000Z ##

'Patch yesterday': Zimbra mail servers under siege through RCE vulnerability #cve_2024_45519 #zimbra #security #infosec #email

"Attackers can, and evidently are, adding bogus CC addresses to emails that spoof Gmail. Instead of legitimate email addresses, CC fields are populated with base64 strings, which are then parsed and executed by Zimbra's mail servers."

https://www.theregister.com/2024/10/02/mass_exploitation_of_zimbra_rce/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-01T19:03:34.834Z ##

@threatinsight over at The Bad Place™: https://twitter.com/threatinsight/status/1841089939905134793

Beginning on September 28, @Proofpoint began observing attempts to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a remote code execution vulnerability in Zimbra mail servers.

The emails spoofing Gmail were sent to bogus addresses in the CC fields in an attempt for Zimbra servers to parse and execute them as commands. The addresses contained base64 strings that are executed with the sh utility.

For unknown reasons, the threat actor is using the same server to send the exploit emails and host second-stage payloads. The activity is unattributed at this time.

Some emails from the same sender used a series of CC'd addresses attempting to build a webshell on a vulnerable Zimbra server. The full CC list is wrapped as a string, and if the base64 blobs are concatenated, they decode to a command to write a webshell to /jetty/webapps/zimbraAdmin/public/jsp/zimbraConfig.jsp.

Once installed, the webshell listens for inbound connection with a pre-determined JSESSIONID Cookie field; if present, the webshell will then parse the JACTION cookie for base64 commands. The webshell has support for command execution via exec or download and execute a file over a socket connection.

cc: @justicerage @wdormann

#zimbra #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45519 #vulnerability #proofofconcept #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-01T18:46:25.174Z ##

Project Discovery: Zimbra - Remote Command Execution (CVE-2024-45519)
Reference: CVE-2024-45519 (score pending, unknown disclosure date) "Fixed a security vulnerability in the postjournal service which may allow unauthenticated users to execute commands"
Project Discovery provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-45519, which is said to be an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability in Zimbra Collaboration. They perform binary diffing to find the root cause: "The vulnerability stems from unsanitized user input being passed to popen in the unpatched version, enabling attackers to inject arbitrary commands." They provide a proof of concept.

Additionally, @justicerage warns of CVE-2024-45519 exploitation in the wild coming from 79.124.49[.]86 h/t: @wdormann

#zimbra #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45519 #vulnerability #proofofconcept #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-01T19:03:34.000Z ##

@threatinsight over at The Bad Place™: https://twitter.com/threatinsight/status/1841089939905134793

Beginning on September 28, @Proofpoint began observing attempts to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a remote code execution vulnerability in Zimbra mail servers.

The emails spoofing Gmail were sent to bogus addresses in the CC fields in an attempt for Zimbra servers to parse and execute them as commands. The addresses contained base64 strings that are executed with the sh utility.

For unknown reasons, the threat actor is using the same server to send the exploit emails and host second-stage payloads. The activity is unattributed at this time.

Some emails from the same sender used a series of CC'd addresses attempting to build a webshell on a vulnerable Zimbra server. The full CC list is wrapped as a string, and if the base64 blobs are concatenated, they decode to a command to write a webshell to /jetty/webapps/zimbraAdmin/public/jsp/zimbraConfig.jsp.

Once installed, the webshell listens for inbound connection with a pre-determined JSESSIONID Cookie field; if present, the webshell will then parse the JACTION cookie for base64 commands. The webshell has support for command execution via exec or download and execute a file over a socket connection.

cc: @justicerage @wdormann

screaminggoat at 2024-10-01T19:03:34.834Z ##

@threatinsight over at The Bad Place™: https://twitter.com/threatinsight/status/1841089939905134793

Beginning on September 28, @Proofpoint began observing attempts to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a remote code execution vulnerability in Zimbra mail servers.

The emails spoofing Gmail were sent to bogus addresses in the CC fields in an attempt for Zimbra servers to parse and execute them as commands. The addresses contained base64 strings that are executed with the sh utility.

For unknown reasons, the threat actor is using the same server to send the exploit emails and host second-stage payloads. The activity is unattributed at this time.

Some emails from the same sender used a series of CC'd addresses attempting to build a webshell on a vulnerable Zimbra server. The full CC list is wrapped as a string, and if the base64 blobs are concatenated, they decode to a command to write a webshell to /jetty/webapps/zimbraAdmin/public/jsp/zimbraConfig.jsp.

Once installed, the webshell listens for inbound connection with a pre-determined JSESSIONID Cookie field; if present, the webshell will then parse the JACTION cookie for base64 commands. The webshell has support for command execution via exec or download and execute a file over a socket connection.

cc: @justicerage @wdormann

Esta situación representa un riesgo significativo para la seguridad de los sistemas comprometidos.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-03T18:34:14.275Z ##

CVE-2024-45519 finally has a working NVD page and CVSSv3 scores: CNA MITRE gives it a perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 (cc: @cR0w) while NVD says 9.8 critical.

cc: @hrbrmstr @ntkramer @iagox86 So I've got this down to a science as to when to check the KEV Catalog for new CVEs: around 10am ET weekdays (11am blog post), with Thursdays 1pm (2pm blog) and Patch Tuesday 2pm (3pm)

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-10-03T18:00:48.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-45519
Vendor: Synacor
Product: Zimbra Collaboration
Date Added: 2024-10-03
Vulnerability: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Command Execution Vulnerability
Notes: https://wiki.zimbra.com/wiki/Zimbra_Security_Advisories ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45519
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45519

##
dangoodin at 2024-10-02T19:00:26.217Z ##

Does anyone have visibility into the ongoing exploitation of the Zimbra vulnerability CVE-2024-45519? Seems like exploitation would be fairly easy if all that's required is sending a malformed email. Further, the ability to remotely execute code seems like this would heighten the severity level. One researcher describes the activity in the wild as "mass exploitation." Can @GossiTheDog and others provide a reality check regarding the ease, severity and volume of the exploitation?

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T18:20:05.000Z ##

Zimbra bug causes alarm among researchers, CERTs after exploitation attempts

Zimbra has issued a patch for a critical vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-45519, but experts are warning the bug has been exploited by malicious...

🔗️ [Therecord] https://link.is.it/48k6cq

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-10-02T16:47:04.000Z ##

Critical #Zimbra #RCE flaw exploited to backdoor servers using #email
The Zimbra remote code execution flaw is tracked as CVE-2024-45519 and exists in Zimbra's postjournal service, which is used to parse incoming emails over #SMTP. Attackers can exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted emails with commands to execute in the CC field, which are then executed when the postjournal service processes the email.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-zimbra-rce-flaw-exploited-to-backdoor-servers-using-emails/

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-10-02T12:30:02.000Z ##

Zimbra Remote Command Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-45519) – Exploit POC Released https://cybersecuritynews.com/zimbra-rce-vulnerability/ #CyberSecurityNews #cybersecuritynews #CyberSecurity #Vulnerability #cybersecurity #vulnerability

##
jbhall56 at 2024-10-02T11:55:22.341Z ##

Enterprise security firm Proofpoint said it began observing the activity starting September 28, 2024. The attacks seek to exploit CVE-2024-45519, a severe security flaw in Zimbra's postjournal service that could enable unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands on affected installations. https://thehackernews.com/2024/10/researchers-sound-alarm-on-active.html

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T06:05:16.000Z ##

Zimbra Collaboration is facing a critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-45519) that allows remote command execution, potentially via crafted SMTP messages. Even if postjournal is disabled, the flaw can still be exploited. Stay informed and take necessary precautions. #cybersecurity

##
justicerage at 2024-10-01T11:05:20.300Z ##

If you're using @zimbra, mass-exploitation of CVE-2024-45519 has begun. Patch yesterday.

Malicious emails are coming from 79.124.49[.]86 and attempting to curl a file from that IP.

CVE-2024-9271
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-04T12:31:09

4 posts

The Re:WP plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.

CVE-2024-9372
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-04T06:30:53

4 posts

The WP Blocks Hub plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-10-03T06:30:38

4 posts

The Social Web Suite – Social Media Auto Post, Social Media Auto Publish plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Directory Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 4.1.11 via the download_log function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to read the contents of arbitrary files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.

CVE-2024-47807
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T21:51:03

3 posts

Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.354.v321ce67a_1de8 and earlier does not check the `iss` (Issuer) claim of an ID Token during its authentication flow, a value that identifies the Originating Party (IdP). This vulnerability may allow attackers to subvert the authentication flow, potentially gaining administrator access to Jenkins. OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.355.v3a_fb_fc

patchnow24x7 at 2024-10-04T04:03:41.693Z ##

CVE-2024-47807 and CVE-2024-47806 :: Patch your Jenkins OpenID Connect Authentication Plugin to mitigate Improper Authentication Flaws..

Advisory:
https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-10-02/#SECURITY-3441%20(2)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T15:13:32.306Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-10-02

  • CVE-2024-47803 (4.3 medium) Exposure of multi-line secrets through error messages in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47804 (4.3 medium) Item creation restriction bypass vulnerability in Jenkins
  • CVE-2024-47805 (4.3 medium) Encrypted values of credentials revealed to users with Extended Read permission in Credentials Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47806 (8.1 high) Lack of audience claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
  • CVE-2024-47807 (8.1 high) Lack of issuer claim validation in OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin

No mention of exploitation. Affected versions are patched:

  • Jenkins weekly should be updated to version 2.479
  • Jenkins LTS should be updated to version 2.462.3
  • Credentials Plugin should be updated to version 1381.v2c3a_12074da_b_
  • OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin should be updated to version 4.355.v3a_fb_fca_b_96d4

#jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

3 posts

Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.354.v321ce67a_1de8 and earlier does not check the `aud` (Audience) claim of an ID Token during its authentication flow, a value to verify the token is issued for the correct client. This vulnerability may allow attackers to subvert the authentication flow, potentially gaining administrator access to Jenkins. OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 4.35

4 posts

This vulnerability is due to insufficient entropy for handlers that are used during SSL VPN session establishment. An unauthenticated a

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T16:23:45.227Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #meraki #cve

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)

    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities

  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)

  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities

  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-20498
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T21:30:34

4 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in the Cisco AnyConnect VPN server of Cisco Meraki MX and Cisco Meraki Z Series Teleworker Gateway devices could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a DoS condition in the AnyConnect service on an affected device. These vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of client-supplied parameters while establishing an SSL VPN session. An attacker could e

##

CVE-2024-20502
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T21:30:34

4 posts

A vulnerability in the Cisco AnyConnect VPN server of Cisco Meraki MX and Cisco Meraki Z Series Teleworker Gateway devices could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a DoS condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient resource management while establishing SSL VPN sessions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a series of crafted HTTPS

    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #meraki #cve

##

CVE-2024-47176
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-10-02T20:15:11.520000

64 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and `cups-browsed` contains network printing functionality including, but not limited to, auto-discovering print services and shared printers. `cups-browsed` binds to `INADDR_ANY:631`, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the `Get-Printer-Attributes` IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. When combined with other

1 repos

#search_error

decio at 2024-10-04T08:41:39.281Z ##

Tien, à propos de la vuln CVE-2024-47176 d'evilsocket apparemment cette dernière peux être utilisée pour alimenter un DDoS avec un potentiel d'amplification de 600x.

En sachant qu'il y en a "deux ou trois"
<> dont des frigos et des brosses à dents <\troll_mais_pas_trop>,
exposés sur Internet avec cups-browsed...

Recently patched CUPS flaw can be used to amplify DDoS attacks
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/recently-patched-cups-flaw-can-be-used-to-amplify-ddos-attacks/

"When CUPS Runneth Over: The Threat of DDoS"
👇
https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/october-cups-ddos-threat

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_47176 #DDoS

##
emory@soc.kvet.ch at 2024-10-01T15:23:44.000Z ##

okay here's something useful for #CUPS #RCE: https://cloud.projectdiscovery.io/?template=CVE-2024-47176

> auto-discovering print services and shared printers. cups-browsed binds to INADDR_ANY-631, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service binding to *-631 ( INADDR_ANY ), multiple bugs in cups-browsed can be exploited in sequence to introduce a malicious printer to the system.

#infosec #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:35:32.084Z ##

Red Hat security advisory: RHBA-2024:7369 - Bug Fix Advisory
See parent toots above for more details about the CUPS vulnerabilities. The rhel9/cups container image has been updated for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 to address RHSA-2024:7346
Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
circuit_cat at 2024-09-27T14:13:37.089Z ##

Print Spoolers committing RCEs

https://securityintelligence.com/news/fysa-critical-rce-flaw-in-gnu-linux-systems/

##
threatcodex at 2024-09-27T13:34:01.151Z ##

Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I
#CVE_2024_47176 #CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47177
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

##
TomSellers at 2024-09-27T13:18:52.066Z ##

FYI for Ubuntu users concerned about the CUPS vulnerability:

Ubuntu released a patch for cups-browsed roughly 16 hours ago. If your system is configured with unattended-upgrades the patch may already be applied. I've seen it automatically applied on two of my lab systems.

As a note, Desktop installations of Ubuntu and Kubuntu appear to be vulnerable in their default state until the patch is applied. Pop!_OS and KDE Neon, both Ubuntu based, are similarly impacted in their default configurations.

Just update your packages and you should be fine.

Reference:
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7042-1

#security #cups #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-04T08:41:39.000Z ##

Tien, à propos de la vuln CVE-2024-47176 d'evilsocket apparemment cette dernière peux être utilisée pour alimenter un DDoS avec un potentiel d'amplification de 600x.

En sachant qu'il y en a "deux ou trois"
<> dont des frigos et des brosses à dents <\troll_mais_pas_trop>,
exposés sur Internet avec cups-browsed...

Recently patched CUPS flaw can be used to amplify DDoS attacks
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/recently-patched-cups-flaw-can-be-used-to-amplify-ddos-attacks/

"When CUPS Runneth Over: The Threat of DDoS"
👇
https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/october-cups-ddos-threat

> auto-discovering print services and shared printers. cups-browsed binds to INADDR_ANY-631, causing it to trust any packet from any source, and can cause the Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL. Due to the service binding to *-631 ( INADDR_ANY ), multiple bugs in cups-browsed can be exploited in sequence to introduce a malicious printer to the system.

SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

See parent toots above for more details about the CUPS vulnerabilities. The rhel9/cups container image has been updated for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 to address RHSA-2024:7346
Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.000Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T13:18:52.000Z ##

FYI for Ubuntu users concerned about the CUPS vulnerability:

Ubuntu released a patch for cups-browsed roughly 16 hours ago. If your system is configured with unattended-upgrades the patch may already be applied. I've seen it automatically applied on two of my lab systems.

As a note, Desktop installations of Ubuntu and Kubuntu appear to be vulnerable in their default state until the patch is applied. Pop!_OS and KDE Neon, both Ubuntu based, are similarly impacted in their default configurations.

Just update your packages and you should be fine.

Reference:
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7042-1

#security #cups #CVE_2024_47176

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.000Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T12:39:22.000Z ##

New CUPS vulnerabilities in #Linux can lead to remote command execution via print jobs. Debian, Fedora, and RHEL are affected. CVE-2024-47176 details: https://t.co/lBdN5A4tZr. To mitigate, disable cups-browsed & block UDP port 631 until patch. #CyberSecurity #LinuxSecurity

secfurry@meow.social at 2024-09-26T20:51:44.000Z ##

So I just read the report on CVE-2024-47176. It should not be a 9.9.
It's literally an exploit on "cups-browsed" over 631/udp, which should not be open to the *net anyway. Like it's a nice overflow exploit, but the barrier to exploit is waaay to high. 🤦‍♀️

#infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

A vulnerability in the REST API and web UI of Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller (NDFC) could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to perform a command injection attack against an affected device. &nbsp; This vulnerability is due to improper user authorization and insufficient validation of command arguments. Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T16:23:45.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  1. Cisco UCS B-Series, Managed C-Series, and X-Series Servers Redfish API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20365 (6.5 medium)
  2. Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Routers Denial of Service and Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20516, CVE-2024-20517, CVE-2024-20522, CVE-2024-20523 and CVE-2024-20524 (6.8 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20518, CVE-2024-20519, CVE-2024-20520 and CVE-2024-20521 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business RV042, RV042G, RV320, and RV325 Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
  3. Cisco Small Business RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation and Remote Command Execution Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20393 (8.8 high) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  4. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator SSL/TLS Certificate Validation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20385 (5.9 medium)
  5. Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Unauthorized REST API Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2024-20442
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:39

2 posts

A vulnerability in the REST API endpoints of Cisco Nexus Dashboard could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to perform limited Administrator actions on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient authorization controls on some REST API endpoints. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to an affected endpoint. A successfu

##

CVE-2024-9423
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

4 posts

Certain HP LaserJet printers may potentially experience a denial of service when a user sends a raw JPEG file to the printer. The printer displays a “JPEG Unsupported” message which may not clear, potentially blocking queued print jobs.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-10-03T23:35:11.000Z ##

CVE-2024-20477
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

2 posts

A vulnerability in a specific REST API endpoint of Cisco NDFC could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, remote attacker to upload or delete files on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because of missing authorization controls on the affected REST API endpoint. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted API requests to the affected endpoint. A successful exploit

    • CVE-2024-20470 (4.7 medium) Cisco RV340, RV340W, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(5.5 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-10-02T18:31:38

2 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller (NDFC), formerly Cisco Data Center Network Manager (DCNM), could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with network-admin privileges to perform a command injection attack against an affected device. &nbsp; This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of command arguments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting

    • CVE-2024-20438 (6.3 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20441 (5.7 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20442 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Unauthorized REST API Endpoints Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20477 (5.4 medium) Cisco NDFC Unauthorized REST API Endpoint Vulnerability
  6. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20490 and CVE-2024-20491 both 6.3 medium
  7. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller REST API Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20444 (5.5 medium)
  8. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20449 (8.8 high)
  9. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-20432 (9.9 critical) 🥵
  10. Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Configuration Backup Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20448 (6.3 medium)
  11. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Session Takeover and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20509 (5.8 medium)
  12. Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20498, CVE-2024-20499, CVE-2024-20501 (8.6 high) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20500 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20502 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN DoS Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20513 (5.8 medium) Cisco Meraki MX and Z Series Teleworker Gateway AnyConnect VPN Targeted DoS Vulnerability
  13. Cisco Identity Services Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-20515 (6.5 medium)
  14. Cisco Expressway Series Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20492 (6.0 medium)

At a glance no mention of exploitation:

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.
Neither the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) nor the Cisco Meraki Incident Response Team is aware of any malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #meraki #cve

CVE-2024-9014
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-01T20:35:11

1 posts

pgAdmin versions 8.11 and earlier are vulnerable to a security flaw in OAuth2 authentication. This vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially obtain the client ID and secret, leading to unauthorized access to user data.

CVE-2020-15415
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.02%

updated 2024-10-01T03:31:35

6 posts

On DrayTek Vigor3900, Vigor2960, and Vigor300B devices before 1.5.1, cgi-bin/mainfunction.cgi/cvmcfgupload allows remote command execution via shell metacharacters in a filename when the text/x-python-script content type is used, a different issue than CVE-2020-14472.

updated 2024-09-30T21:02:18

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Infinera hiT 7300 5.60.50. A hidden SSH service (on the local management network interface) with hardcoded credentials allows attackers to access the appliance operating system (with highest privileges) via an SSH connection.

Even on 7300 Series SDN platform from Infinera - Multi-Haul Transport Platform especially for long-range optical equipments...
